Yes, keeping a few things in mind while practicing advanced yoga poses can help prevent lower back pain:

1. Warm-up: Practice some gentle warm-up poses before doing any advanced pose to loosen up your muscles and increase flexibility, especially in your lower back. 2. Maintain proper alignment: Focus on maintaining proper alignment while doing poses like upward-facing dog, wheel pose, and especially when in spinal twist poses. This will help reduce the strain on your lower back. 3. Use props: Use props like blocks, blankets or straps to support your body in poses like camel pose, pigeon pose or any other pose that puts pressure on your lower back. 4. Engage your core: Engaging your core muscles will help support your lower back when doing poses that require deep backbends. 5. Listen to your body: Always listen to your body and stop immediately if you experience any discomfort or pain in your lower back. It is always advised to consult your doctor or a certified yoga teacher before starting any new poses or if you have a pre-existing condition of lower back pain.
